material.mattext:
The atoms of two elements A and B (these letters do not represent their chemical symbols) have the following electronic configuration:

    A: 1s2 2s2 2p6 3s2 3p6 4s2
    B: 1s2 2s2 2p5

Which one of the following statements is correct ?
The first ionisation energy of A is greater than that of B.
The first ionisation energies of A and B are equal.
The first ionisation energy of B is greater than that of A.
It is impossible to tell which first ionisation energy is greater.
The atomic number of A and B is the same for both elements.

The balanced equation for the combustion of propanol is :

2 C3H7OH + 9 O2   →   6 CO2 + 8 H2O

How many moles of oxygen would be required for the combustion of 10 moles of propanol?

item.title: 003 234. The list below gives the n

material.mattext:
The list below gives the names of different types of bonding that can be found in chemical substances.

Select from the list the type(s) of bonding present in a piece of zinc.

The graph shows the variation with temperature of the maximum solubility of potassium nitrate (KNO3) in water. The solubility is expressed as grams of KNO3 dissolved in 100 grams of water.

Use the information in the graph to answer the following question:
A solution containing 100 g KNO3 in 100 g H2O is cooled down from 100°C. At what temperature, to the nearest degree, are the first crystals of KNO3 likely to appear?

A to E are aqueous solutions, each containig 0.010 mol of solute per dm3.

A NH3(aq) 0.010 mol/dm3
B CH3COONa(aq) 0.010 mol/dm3
C HCl(aq) 0.010 mol/dm3
D CH3COOH(aq) 0.010 mol/dm3
E NaOH(aq) 0.010 mol/dm3

Answer each of the questions by selecting the appropriate solution from A to E above.
Which solution, when mixed with equal volume of solution B, forms a buffer solution.
Which solution, in which the solute undergoes partial ionisation, has pH greater than 7.

Answer this question by moving the pointer of your mouse to the diagram that best represents the relationship stated below.

Relationship:
The change in temperature (Y) with time (X) when a fixed mass of water is heated at a constant rate.
For each of the following compounds, identify the oxidation number of the sulphur.

When an inorganic salt is heated in a Bunsen flame, the colour of the flame turns green.

This indicates that the salt contains:

item.title: 009 277. A weak acid, HA, dissociates according t

material.mattext:
A weak acid, HA, dissociates according to:

HA  H+(aq) + A-(aq)

The dissociation constant, Ka, of the acid is 1.0×10-7 mol·l-1. The approximate pH of a 0.1 mol·l-1 solution of this acid is:

What kind of a reaction is represented by the following equation?

CH3CH(OH)NH-NH2   →   CH3CH=N-NH2 + H2O

The following table shows the number of electrons in six neutral atoms labelled E to X.

Atom 

E

G

J

L

M

X

Number of electrons

6

9

14

16

18

19


Use the letter at the top of a column in the table to represent the element or one atom of the element.

Question: Which element is in the same group of the Periodic Table as E?

Equal masses of oxygen and hydrogen are made to react in a closed container:

2 H2(g) + O2(g)   →   2 H2O(l)

After the reaction is complete, the container will contain:

Data
Compound Formula mass g/mol Boiling point
°C
Sodium Chloride (NaCl) 58.5 1413
Tetrachloromethane (CCl4) 154 77

The best explanation, why tetrachloromethane has much lower boiling point than sodium chloride, despite its higher formula mass, is:
NaCl is a solid and CCl4 is a liquid.
NaCl is ionic and CCl4 is covalent.
NaCl is an inorganic substance whereas CCl4 is an organic substance.
NaCl is soluble in water whereas CCl4 is not.
NaCl is based upon a cubic unit lattice but CCl4 has a tetrahedral structure.
Which one of the following compounds forms molecular crystals in the solid state?
At 25°C an aqueous solution of potassium hydroxide, KOH, has the concentration of 0.010 mol/dm3.
In the diagram below, which vertical distance representd the heat (enthalpy) of reaction?
Which of the following changes is not an oxidation?
Which element shown in the above Periodic Table...
has the highest number of protons in its atoms?
always has the oxidation number +2 in its compounds?

N2(g) + 3 H2(g)    2NH3(g)       ΔH < 0

What will be the effect of increasing the concentration of hydrogen in the equilibrium mixture?
There is a decrease in the yield of ammonia.
There is an increase in the yield of ammonia.
There is an increase in the temperature of the mixture.
The value of the equilibrium constant changes.
Which of the following is the repeating unit of polystyrene?

Examine the following statements concerning relationships in the Periodic Table.
For each statement, indicate whether it is true or false.
The properties of the first element in each group of the Periodic Table tend to be different from those of the other elements in the group.
As you move across the Periodic Table from left to right, the character of the elements changes from non-metallic to metallic.
As you move down in a group of the Periodic Table, the maximum valency of the elements increases.
The atoms of the elements in a particular group of the Periodic Table have the same outer electron configuration.

The graph below shows the amount of precipitate formed when 2 cm3 portions of 0.10 mol/l sodium hydroxide are gradually added to exactly 10.0 cm3of 0.10 mol/l copper sulphate. The amount of precipitate is indicated by its height in the test-tube.

From the information in the graph, the chemical composition of the precipitate is best described by the formula:

Consider the following chemical species:

NH3 BF3 NO2- H2O NH4+

For each chemical species, select from diagrams A to F the one that best represents its molecular geometry.

Cadmium hydroxide, Cd(OH)2, is sparingly soluble in water. Which of the following actions will change the Cd2+concentration in a solution of cadmium hydroxide which is formed by mixing water with an excess of solid Cd(OH)2?

Select true if the action changes the Cd++ concentration. Otherwise, choose false.
Changing the temperature of the solution.
Adding solid cadmium chloride to the solution.
Adding some hydrochloric acid to the solution.
Adding some aqueous sodium hydroxide to the solution.

One of the following formulae does not represent 2-methylpentane.
Click this formula, using your computer mouse.

item.title: 026 466. A container is filled with an e

material.mattext: A container is filled with an equal number of moles of helium and neon. Which one of the following statements about this mixture is true?
The neon atoms have a greater average kinetic energy than the helium atoms.
The neon atoms have a greater average speed than the helium atoms.
The helium atoms have a greater average kinetic energy than the neon atoms.
The helium atoms have the greater average collision rate with the walls than the neon atoms.
The neon atoms have the same average speed as the helium atoms.
In which of the following reactions does H2SO4 act as an oxidising agent?
Which one of the following statements about the halogen group is correct?
Electronegativity increases from fluorine to iodine.
First ionisation energy decreases from iodine to fluorine.
Fluorine has the smallest tendency to be reduced.
Bromine is a stronger oxidising agent than fluorine.
Which one of the following reactions is accompanied by an increase in entropy?
A compound X has the formula C3H8O. On oxidation it changes to C3H6O. This information suggests that X is:
